instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Power button problem
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board problem, with power button, when holding down 5 secs or more it boots normaly, but when i press once it only make quarter fan spin and not booting.
where to start. changed <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> still same, tested without trackpad also, with pins 5116 and 5115

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Power button problem
threads.message:
Post all <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> voltages.

Does the board turn on itself when connect the charger (no battery)?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Power button problem
threads.message: yes, i reballed smc, and now everything works, case closed
